author: Staff Reporter
text:
As many as 91 police inspectors in West Zone serving under the eight district police offices and three police commissionerates have been transferred. Names of transferred officers were released from the office of the Inspector General of Police on Wednesday night.

These officers had served in the same district or city for more than three years and have been transferred in view of the Assembly elections. These transferred inspectors include 33 in Coimbatore, with 21 of them in the city and 12 others in Coimbatore district.

Police Commissioners of Coimbatore, Salem and Tirupur City and Superintendents of Police of Coimbatore, Salem and Tirupur district and The Nilgiris, Erode, Namakkal, Dharmapuri and Krishnagiri would soon be issuing orders in this connection. Police sources said that these transfers were with immediate effect.

Inspectors have to be relieved by the respective head of the respective city and district unit and they have to take charge at the new stations within the zone without delay.
title: 91 police inspectors in West Zone transferred
